DOC.brief_title: The Effect Body Mass Index Etonogestrel Hormone Levels Women Using Single-rod Contraceptive Implant
DOC.detailed_description: Two-thirds reproductive-age woman United States either overweight obese . Body composition may affect contraceptive hormone metabolism possibly efficacy . Phase III study date include woman weigh 70 kilogram ( 134 923 , 14.5 % ) ; report pregnancy group . Data pregnancy rate woman higher body mass index ( BMI ) categories use etonogestrel implant exists , know little weight affect serum etonogestrel level . Progestin-only method , etonogestrel implant , may prefer combined method include estrogens obesity increase thrombosis risk . The investigator propose prospective study compare serum etonogestrel level second third year implant use woman across body mass index category . Based previous study , investigator expect difference etonogestrel level base body weight ; however , investigator hypothesize etonogestrel level remain threshold ovulation suppression three year implant use woman across BMI category . The investigator measure serum level etonogestrel normal weight ( BMI < 25kg/m2 ) , overweight ( BMI ≥ 25kg/m2 < 30kg/m2 ) , obese woman ( BMI ≥ 30kg/m2 ) use single-rod contraceptive implant least twelve month . Their primary objective compare three group evaluate whether etonogestrel level fall critical level contraceptive efficacy ( 90 pg/mL ) ( Díaz 1991 ) group .
